eu_initiatives:
We follow most aspects of EU bank prudential regulation, 
including in particular various aspects of the single European rule book like the Capital Requirements Regulation (CRR) and the Capital Requirements Directive (CRD IV); the Bank Recovery and Resolution Directive (BRRD); and, the Deposit Guarantee Schemes Directive (DGSD).
section: II - In-house lobbyists and trade/business/professional associations
relevant_communication: Recently, we have met with Commission staff, MEPs and Council members to discuss EU proposals to (1) require large third country banks to establish an intermediate parent undertaking for their EU operations; and (2) establish a payments moratorium that EU authorities could impose on troubled banks in Europe.
goals__remit: Advance the interest of our owner banks, which are 25 of the largest banks operating in the United States, including mostly U.S.-headquartered banks but also some global banks headquartered in Europe and Asia.  We are focused mostly, but not exclusively, on prudential policy impacting banking organizations.
